Description: Elephant ivory toilet-spoon; circular bowl; long handle(repaired) with ornate terminal.
Curator's comments: The head of an ibex is carved at the top of the handle. The horns are deeply serrated and curve back, forming a loop. The head is rendered as a long triangular projection with no internal details.
Bibliographic references: Brunton & Caton-Thompson 1928 / The Badarian Civilisation and Predynastic Remains near Badari (p. 38, pl. VII, XXIV.23, XXIII.2c)
